intro: Sparattanthelium amazonum, commonly known as the Amazonian spirea, is a flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its dense, wiry stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found along the banks of rivers and in swampy areas. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a unique texture to the undergrowth. Sparattanthelium amazonum plays a vital role in the ecosystem by supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
